author: Madurai Bureau
text:
“Withdraw contributory pension scheme, rectify wages parities”

An office in Tirunelveli Collectorate wearing a deserted look on Wednesday.— Photo: A. Shaikmohideen

Functioning of government departments across the district was affected as around 50 per cent of the government employees struck work on Wednesday to highlight their demands.

As their talks with ministers “failed,’ the government employees commenced their indefinite strike on Wednesday, which caused a lot of problems to the public visiting these offices.

As more than 30 per cent of the nutritious meal centre and anganwadi workers also participated in the strike, preparing meals for children in some centres was affected.

Expressing solidarity with the striking employees, members of Tamil Nadu Government All Departments Pensioners’ Association, who staged a demonstration on the Collectorate premises, said the State government should withdraw contributory pension scheme, rectify wages parities etc.

Kanyakumari

Out of over 6,000 government employees, over 1,000 absented for duty, mostly from the rural development sections, across the district and at the Collectorate.

Chief Educational Officer V. Jayakumar told The Hindu that all government and aided high and higher secondary schools functioned without any disruption, as only a few teachers were absent.

Over thousand members staged a demonstration in front of the Collectorate in Nagercoil and in front of the taluk offices in Kalkulam in Thuckalay and Kuzhithurai in Vilavancod.
title: Government employees on indefinite strike
